1st Year Issue/ Condition: Forested  Ditch erosion / Noxious Weed / Listed Plant
1st Year (2014) Issue(s): Erosion control in place but requires replacement. Repaired in winter 2014. Perennial sow-thistle (Sonchus arvensis) population observed.  Listed plant location TLRS01 inspected and presence of ostrich fern (Matteuccia struthiopteris) confirmed.  Monitor in 2015 and control weeds as required. Listed plant issue resolved.
3rd Year (2016) PCRM Assessment and Work: June 22, 2016 – Intermittent narrow leaved hawks beard, recommend implementation of control measures. July 10, 2016 - Vegetation is well established with desirable species throughout ROW. Good establishment of grasses and shrubs. - No erosion or subsidence issues. - Diversion berms are well vegetated and functioning.  - Intermittent herbicide application conducted to control narrow leaved hawks beard, perennial sow thistle (KP 74+800) and scentless chamomile (KP 75+000 – 75+050 at foreign line crossing and KP 74+650).  Sept 14, 2016 - 75-85% vegetation established compared to off ROW. - Seasonal drain runs west to east along the north boundary of ROW at KP 75+450.- Sediment and erosion control berms at KP 75+350 slope are functional and well vegetated. - Intermittent herbicide application conducted to perennial sow thistle (KP 75+070). - Erosion noted in 2014 is no longer present, issue resolved.

1st Year Issue/ Condition: Treed Wetland/ Forested  Ineffective spread of woody debris / Listed plant
1st Year (2014) Issue(s): Powerline activity – woody materials have been moved to accommodate power pole and wire reel laydown yard. Rollback was replaced in January 2015. Adjacent listed plant sites TKRS006 - purple peavine (Lathyrus venosus) and tall meadow rue (Thalictrum dsycarpum) and TKRS003 – ostrich fern (Matteuccia struthiopteris). Minimal disturbance to area, moderate to high vegetation regrowth observed. Listed plant issue resolved Monitor in 2015.
3rd Year (2016) PCRM Assessment and Work: June 20, 2016 – Intermittent narrow leaved hawks beard, recommend implementation of control measures. - Wetland observed to be on an acceptable trajectory of reaching pre-construction functional condition. Pre-construction contours restored.  No indication of excessive ponded water or impeded flow due to the construction ROW.  Continued monitoring of vegetation is recommended July 10, 2016 - Vegetation is well established with desirable species throughout ROW. Good establishment of grasses, and shrubs.  - No erosion or subsidence issues. - Intermittent herbicide application conducted to control perennial sow thistle (valve site and highway ditch) and scentless chamomile (valve site) and narrow leaved hawks beard through-out tract. Sept 14, 2016 – Intermittent herbicide application conducted to control scentless chamomile. - Woody debris noted in 2014 is no longer present, issue resolved.
